intro: Coliquea quila, commonly known as the silverleaf orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pale green foliage and intricate, fragrant flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its unique appearance makes it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and conservation efforts. Due to habitat loss, Coliquea quila is classified as endangered, highlighting the need for continued protection and study.
